thread.title: Platini calls reports of a 90-day suspension 'insidious'
thread.title_full: Platini calls reports of a 90-day suspension 'insidious'

title: Platini calls reports of a 90-day suspension 'insidious'
text:
Updated: 6:22 a.m. Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015 | Posted: 6:21 a.m. Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015 Platini calls reports of a 90-day suspension 'insidious' Related FILE - In this June 1, 2011 file photo Swiss FIFA President Joseph Blatter, right, and French UEFA President Michel Platini walk together at the 61st FIFA Congress in Zurich, Switzerland. (AP Photo/Michael Probst, file) Sponsored Links The Associated Press NYON, Switzerland â€” 
UEFA President Michel Platini says reports that he will be given a 90-day suspension by the FIFA ethics committee are "insidious" and an attempt to damage his reputation. 
Platini, the favorite to replace FIFA President Sepp Blatter, called the news of his possible suspension a "deliberate leak." 
Blatter is also facing a 90-day suspension after being investigated for financial misconduct. 
Platini also says he has submitted the required letters of support for FIFA presidential candidates. The election is scheduled for Feb. 26. Copyright The Associated Press Sign up for our WFTV Morning News Headlines Newsletter Sign Up
